title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)
description: A year after harvest, this ripe wine is showing the creamy side of Alvarinho. It hasn't lost its bright fruit, giving lemon as well as light toast from wood aging. Drink this wine now.

title: Château de Virecourt 2014 Cuvée Pillebourse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Owned by Xavier Chassagnoux, who also has vineyards in Fronsac, this estate has produced a rich wine. It has the typical fruity character of the vintage with its soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berries are lightly supported by the open structure. Drink the wine now.

title: Château des Tourtes 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: As with so many wines from Blaye, this is dominated by Merlot. That gives a ripe full wine that is spicy and full of black-plum fruits. Firm tannins still show through the fruits that are balanced by acidity. The wine still needs to age, so drink from 2018.

title: Delfino 2014 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: There are still some rough edges here: hints of volatility, burnt wood notes and unintegrated barrel flavors. But there is substantial red fruit at the core, and it's got plenty of punch and power to stand up to a smoky barbequed meal.

title: Vino 2015 Rosé Sangiovese (Washington)
description: A very pretty pale salmon color, cherry and spice aromas are followed by light, tart, dry, mouthwatering fruit flavors. The concentration seems light but there's still much to enjoy.

title: Weisinger 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: As is often true of Southern Oregon Pinot Noir, this has a rather chunky fruit character, showing a cherry candy flavor. Aged in 30% new French oak, the wine is very lightly toasty, with a touch of heat in the finish.

title: ZaHa 2014 Toko Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)
description: Dry woody herbal berry aromas are leafy and a bit murky. This Cab Franc is fiercely tannic and drying, while oaky flavors of wood spice dominate generic berry fruit. Flavors of mint and pepper lead a rough and tannic finish.

title: Sedosa 2015 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Clean, stony aromas are more neutral than fruity. This feels good and standard, with fresh acidity. Mild flavors of citrus, stone fruits and yeast fade quickly on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: A soft and fruity wine, this is ripe with dark cherry and spice flavors. A hint of bananas from the fermentation spoils the rest of the ripe fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.

title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers
description: It is the high proportion of perfumed Sauvignon Gris in this wine that creates its ripe, smooth and rich character. It brings in a calming, rounding influence to the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc and will allow it to develop a creamy character as it develops. Drink from summer 2017.

title: Quinta do Pôpa 2012 Pôpa Tinta Roriz (Douro)
description: An unusual 100% Tinta Roriz, this wine is ripe with well-integrated tannins and good acidity. Blackberry fruits give crispness and a full body. This attractive wine is ready to drink.

title: San Pedro de Yacochuya 2015 Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Aromas of orange blossom, lychee and lemon peel are potent and oily. In the mouth, this is thick for Torrontés, with distinct oiliness. Flavors of tropical fruits and lychee are pithy and full of pyrazines.

title: A. de Luze et Fils 2015 La Belle Citadelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Named after the fortress at Blaye on the banks of the Gironde, the wine is easygoing and approachable. It has generous black-currant fruits, shot through with acidity, and is given structure by some dense tannins. Drink this wine from 2017.

title: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This is a ripe wine that has a high proportion of Sémillon in the blend. That makes it rich: revealing yellow fruits as well as greener herbal characters. It is fruity, tangy and refreshing. Drink from spring 2017.

title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Fortin Plaisance  (Saint-Émilion)
description: This ripe Saint-Émilion is generous with its rounded perfumed Merlot. It gives the wine richness, juicy acidity and an open texture. Touches of tannin do bring in some structure, but the emphasis is on the fruitiness and fresh aftertaste. Drink from late 2017.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Chardonnay-Arinto-Vital White (Lisboa)
description: This ripe, creamy wine contains the rare Vital in the blend. That grape gives crisp, tight acidity while the Chardonnay brings out the smoother, richer side of this balanced and fruity wine. Drink now.

title: Del Rio 2015 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)
description: This young wine could use additional bottle age. The edges are sharp and there is some bite to the fruit. Citrus pith and rind flavors dominate, rather than flesh. It's spare and lightly bitter in the finish.

title: Caves Bonifacio 2012 Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)
description: This ripe, juicy wine offers immediately attractive red-berry fruits. With deep color from the red-juice Alicante Bouschet, the wine is perfumed and generous. Acidity gives a final lift.

title: Château Champ du Moulin 2015  Bordeaux
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, easy and fruity wine. It has light tannins, juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is still young, showing off its fruitiness and will be ready to drink soon, from early 2017.

title: Château de Lavernette 2014 Cuvée Jadis Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)
description: This wine, made from organically grown grapes, is ripe, full of red-cherry fruits and soft tannins. It is an immediately attractive wine, packed with fruitiness and ready to drink. The village of Leynes is on the border between Beaujolais and Macon.

title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2015 Alba de Sierra Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and citrus aromas are a touch briny. This feels pulpy, with standard weight and balance. Dry bready yeasty melon and white-fruit flavors finish with a salty side note.

title: Bodkin 2014 The Crown Jewels Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a viscous, pruney dessert wine made from 45% Zinfandel and 55% Mixed Blacks. Labeled as 8% residual sugar, it exhibits that sweetness in an intensity of ripe, tannic blackberry and leather.

title: Naia 2015 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Spunky passion fruit and citric aromas are far from dull. This feels racy due to strong citric acidity. Lime and passion fruit flavors follow the nose, while this is quick and simple on the finish.

title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château le Mayne Turon  (Bordeaux)
description: Grown in the far eastern edge of Bordeaux, in the Entre-deux-Mers, this is a bright and fruity wine. It has tannins that just lift the juicy red and black-currant fruits.

title: Illuminati Dino 2015 Riparosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of spiced plum, purple flower, leather and truffle lead the nose on this informal wine. The solid palate offers dried cherry and a hint of licorice alongside grippy tannins that clench the finish.

title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)
description: This inexpensive wine is enjoyable to drink for its raisin aromas, ample fruit flavors and comparatively soft, easy texture for the variety.

title: Rozes 2013 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)
description: This attractive wine is full of ripe fruit, with soft tannins and only light acidity. It is developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.

title: Elephant Seven 2014 First and Mercer Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Monette's Vineyard Grenache and River Rock Syrah (15%). The volatiles are amped up, along with aromas of raspberries and herb. The flavors are full and liquorous, showing a fair amount of heat.

title: Plungerhead 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bacon fat, smoked meat and caramelized onions initially come to mind in this rich, robust red, blended with the tiniest amount of Merlot. Blackberry jam, tar, gunpowder and black pepper characterize the mix of savory with ripe, while the tannin profile remains soft.

title: Remy 2013 Lone Madrone Vineyard Lagrein (Willamette Valley)
description: Oregon Lagrein has to be about as rare as it gets. It's almost jet black, yet just 10% alcohol. It's a dark musky tannic wine, yet dilute and acidic, with little fruit flavor. Best paired with a burger or flank steak.
